data.title: CSS highlight inside PHP files
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new PHP file with this content:
```php
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="ie=edge">
    <title>Document</title>

    <style>
    .test {
        color: #fff;
    }

    <?php
    echo $css;
    ?>
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    
</body>
</html>
```
2. Notice that after the `$css;` the highlight of CSS expands to the end of the file.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: API for detecting Insiders version
data.body:
I've made an [extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fabiospampinato.vscode-install-vsix) for installing .vsix files with a right click, under the hood it calls `code --install-extension`, therefor it doesn't work if triggered from Code Insiders, where it should instead call `code-insiders --install-extension`.

In order for this to work properly I need an API for detecting if the extension is running inside Code or Code Insiders.

data.title: Incorrect brackets match in markdown text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
python|don|0.7.0
shell-format|fox|1.0.0
MagicPython|mag|1.0.12
cpptools|ms-|0.12.3
python|tht|0.2.3
shellcheck|tim|0.1.0



---
I was writing a markdown file, and found the right bracket matching incorrect  to the bracket in a code string. The text i wrote is shown as followed.

```
By searching code with `pcregrep` (with regex `\bmain\s*\(`)
```

The last right bracket did not match the first one, but the one in regex.

I have try some similar case in C code but it works well. I think there may be something special that forget to make effect on markdown file.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Fix unnatural machine-generated Japanese translation of "n of m" in the text-search box
data.body:
Japanese don't use “の” as the context of “[number] (out) of [number]” such as the following illustrative sentences.  The “of” is translated to “中” or “のうち (の)” in many cases.
 
> It displays 150 of the 1,290 in order.
> 順に１，２９０件中１５０件を表示します
>
> http://ejje.weblio.jp/sentence/content/of+%22%E4%BB%B6%E4%B8%AD%22

> Five of the seven were found dead, and two are still missing.
> ７人中５人が遺体で見つかり，２人はいまだに行方がわからない。
>
> http://ejje.weblio.jp/sentence/content/of+%22%E4%BA%BA%E4%B8%AD%22

> Nine of the 12 had to agree for an indictment to be made.
> 起訴するには12人のうち９人が賛成しなければならなかった。
>
> and it was one of the other four who fell.
> 倒れたのは、他の４人のうちの１人だった。
>
> http://ejje.weblio.jp/sentence/content/of+%22%E4%BA%BA%E3%81%AE%E3%81%86%E3%81%A1%22

> Only 5 of the 120 cases docketed were tried.
> 訴訟事件表に記載された120件のうち5件だけが審理された
>
> http://ejje.weblio.jp/sentence/content/of+%22%E4%BB%B6%E3%81%AE%E3%81%86%E3%81%A1%22

However, regular translations (e.g. n of m → m 件中 n 件目 or m 件のうちの n 件目) seem to be too verbose to adopt for the small area of the text-search box, so I suggest an abbreviated translation “n/m 件” that is adopted in Microsoft Word instead of them and the original machine-generated and unnatural one that is said not to be changed.

P.S. I feel “最初の 999 の結果だけを強調表示しますが、テキスト全体を検索します。” strange because it lacks an numeraration “件” of 999, but this PR does not contain fix of it.

data.title: Allow to fix tabs (like pinning in Chrome)
data.body: A interesting thing I see in browsers, specially Google Chrome, is the feature to fix tabs. It would be possible to implement it in Visual Studio Code? Sometimes I close by mistake the open tabs of editor. Thanks!

data.title: Switch Ctrl+Alt+Up/Down with Ctrl+Alt+Up/Down

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The current default keyboard shortcuts are: `Ctrl + Alt + Up / Down` creates another cursor one line above / below the current line, while `Shift + Alt + Up / Down` duplicates the current line.

I propose to swap these keybindings because they conceptually switched.

Often the `Ctrl` key is associated with duplicating or copying something. This already happens in VSCode when you drag a selection while holding `Ctrl`, the selection is copied rather than moved.

On the other hand, one can also argue that `Shift` is often associated with selecting things, and adding a new cursor is kinda similar. In VSCode, if I click and drag while holding down `Shift + Alt`, I get a (rectangular) selection with multiple cursors.

From this point of view it would be logical to have `Shift + Alt` spawn new cursors and `Ctrl + Alt` duplicate the current line.

data.title: Not getting terminate event from node when reload EH
data.body:

2. Reload the window you are debugging

data.title: Allow to open workspace files that are invalid JSON files
data.body:
We use the standard `JSON.parse()` to read the contents of workspace files, but we should rather use our fault tolerant JSON parser (`vs/base/json`) so that e.g. trailing commas are no problem.

/cc @sandy081 @aeschli

data.title: Feature Request: Extending the Problems Tab
data.body: It would be really great if there was a possibility to extend the Problems tab in VSCode. In particular, there should be a way to control the context menu items for each selected item or items. That would allow applying fixes (where applicable) directly from the tab, and not clicking on the light bulb next to every issue in the code (i.e. PowerShell/vscode-powershell#717).

data.title: Show extension display name in the hover of notification
data.body:
We should show extension display name instead of extension name in the hover of message. Because,  extension id is nothing but `${publisher_id}.${extension.name}`. Showing extension name again is redundant.

![kapture 2017-08-30 at 10 42 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10746682/29863527-4031f6e2-8d70-11e7-857b-fd4ec724ad95.gif)

data.title: Extract function converts tabs into spaces
How to finish a snippet halfway through
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Ultimate x64

Hello. I found a bug.
When I type ```!```, to expand the html template emmet displays the result on the cursor between the body tags. After pressing the enter key, ```device-width``` is selected, the cursor is placed after it, and the cursor is placed after the html tag. To remove the cursor after the html tag and selected ```device-width```, I need to press the esc key twice. For example, if I type the div tag, then it works. The cursor is placed between the tags.

**GIF**

![expand](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29632606/29809141-5a00683e-8cde-11e7-810d-72cd8db771b6.gif)
